results.title: Flowergirl
results.creator_credit: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson and Red Carpet Productions
results.brief_description: Daisuke, Hana and Tetsu are three young Japanese tourists who share a flat in Sydney’s Bondi Beach. Daisuke has to return to Japan to work in his father’s butcher shop but his return is made bitter because of his falling in love with Hana. Featuring a fragmented narrative utilising video and 16mm film, this beautifully shot short film was voted the Best Short Film of 1999 by the Critic’s Circle of Australia.

results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: David Pritchard, John Chase, Pam Stockley and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Floyd travels through locations in Australia, meeting people, seeing different sights and cooking dishes in exotic surroundings. In Central Australia he dines on a silver service table on the Adelaide River. In West Australia he creates a piquant sauce for the wife of Australian millionaire, Alan Bond. In the outback Floyd cooks for the Bishop of The Kimberleys. He eats aboriginal food on a bush tucker tour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Pritchard, John Chase, Pam Stockley and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Flipping the world
results.creator_credit: Moira Simpson, George Johnson, Gillian Darling Kovanic and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Inspired by the documentary “Through a blue lens” (311463) which also features the work of the Odd Squad - Vancouver police officers who, since 1998, have been filming people addicted to drugs. “Flipping the World” is a brutally honest look at the world of youth and drug addiction, told by those who have been there. A culturally diverse group of seven high school students meets with members of the Odd Squad. The students talk to the police, then meet young people who are in recovery, and others still struggling with drug addiction. In the process, their views on drugs and the people who use them undergo important shifts. The students become more understanding and empathetic, and they reveal their own drug experiences. An important discussion-starter, “Flipping the World” provides a wealth of teaching material for educators and others who work with young people.

results.title: Flip book [interactive]
results.brief_description:
An interactive allowing visitors to make their own flip books that can be saved to their Lens. Visitors can also purchase printed versions of their flip books in the ACMI Shop.

Visitors stand in front of flipbook maker and select ‘record’, they are then advised to ‘get ready’.

When recording, a count down timer will advise of how long visitors have left.

Visitors can then save their flipbook to their lens and then proceed to the ACMI shop for printing.

This interactive was re-booted from ACMI’s previous exhibition “Screen Worlds” because it was a crowd favourite. The design of the interactive and flipbook has been updated.

results.title: Flip and two twisters
results.creator_credit: Shirley Horrocks, Robin Laing and Point of View Productions
results.brief_description: This illuminating documentary explores the career of New Zealand artist and filmmaker Len Lye, drawing on recently discovered footage of the artist discussing his pioneering ‘direct film’ technique and working on his large kinetic steel sculptures (beautifully shot by Leon Narby). New Zealand sculptor Evan Webb, who has dedicated his career to preserving the original intention and legacy of Len Lye, is interviewed about the process of realising some of Len Lye large scale projects posthumously. It is Lye’s lifetime study of movement that drives the content of the documentary. His purists explorations from his films to sculpture and his search for a sense of harmonics - ‘the natural frequency of materials’ is captured here. The film includes footage of his films “Colour box” (1935) and sculptures ‘Wind Wand’, ‘Round Head’, ‘Fountain’, ‘Blade’ and ‘Trilogy: Flip & Two Twisters’.

results.title: Flint miners of the Nullabor
results.creator_credit: Robert Edwards, Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and S A Museum
results.brief_description: Koonalda Cave in the Nullabor had been worked as a flint quarry 20,000 years ago. Flint had been used by prehistoric man to fashion simple, functional implements. The first known ventures of Australians into the realm of art were discovered on the walls of the cave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Edwards, Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and S A Museum

results.title: Flora: scenes from a leadership convention
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Arthur Hammond, Michael McKennirey, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fresh, incisive look at Canadian politics, this film penetrates the surface glitter of the 1976 Progressive Conservative Party leadership convention, focusing on the campaign of Cape Bretoner Flora MacDonald, the first woman to contest her party’s leadership. (Follow-up film: Reflections on a Leadership Convention.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Raymont, Arthur Hammond, Michael McKennirey, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Flight of the innocent = La Corsa dell' innocente
results.creator_credit: Carlo Carlei, Domenico Procacci, Franco Castaldi, Cristaldifilm and Fandango
results.brief_description: This breathtakingly visual film, the first feature by Carlo Carei, captures the emotions and arouses the senses. Since 1966, due to the depressed economy in southern Italy, kidnapping has become almost an alternative industry. Men, women and children, from the wealthy north are kidnapped and used as bartering chips by their merciless captors. Feuds develop between rival gangs. Many survive…others are not so fortunate. The story centres upon Vito, a young Italian child whose family are in the kidnapping business and are brutally murdered by a rival gang. He escapes on a perilous journey with the murderers in hot pursuit. Although “Flight of the innocent” is fictional, similar events to those depicted continue to occur. Italian dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: Recreation and leisure
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to appreciate the benefits of recreation and leisure, learn how to develop a recreation and leisure program, develop the skills to instruct residents and learn how to evaluate the success of the program. Accompanied by 31p. in-service training manual. At the conclusion of this program the “No excuses. Life. Be In It” advertisment targeting people with disabilities and featuring an amputee, deaf person and paraplegic is screened.

results.title: Flies: the great Australian salute!
results.brief_description: This video examines the physiology and life cycle of the Australian fly and shows in a humorous way how they have a place in our culture.
